snippet: A majority of pediatricians acquiesce to parents who wish to delay vaccinating their children, a new survey has found.
abstract: Study in journal Pediatrics finds wide majority of doctors accommodate parents who want to delay vaccinating their children, even though this puts children at risk for variety of ailments; experts say deference is result of doctoring style which treats patients as partners but lack of physician guide for how to advise patients about vaccines may be in part responsible.
lead_paragraph: A majority of pediatricians acquiesce to parents who wish to delay vaccinating their children, a new survey has found.
